website_summaries.verdict: An excellent value. Can be mounted anywhere and offers very quick access.
pros: Easy to mount and conceal anywhere you need quick access to your pistol
Large enough to hold most handguns and stores 20 fingerprints
cons: Runs batteries out of power quickly, so must be tested often

customer_reviews.title: Opened With A Gum Wrapper
customer_reviews.text: This is the first gun safe I've opened with a gum wrapper, Wrigley's Extra to be precise. I've opened handgun safes with paperclips, pieces of coat hanger wire, 7-Eleven Slurpee straws, coffee stirrers, but never a gum wrapper--until now. Here's my main problem with this GunVault device: I first compromised a GunVault product back in 2015, and one would think that a company caught selling defectively designed products would recognize the need to have their remaining product line evaluated before being exposed again for selling junk. But not GunVault. Apparently GunVault would rather deal with public humiliation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safe not safe 🤔👎
customer_reviews.text: The lock on this thing is ridiculously easy to pick. Mine came locked with no key and a dead battery. With a wire crimp tube and a paperclip it took about 10 seconds to unlock. For the price of this thing, that's absurd.
customer_reviews.author: viable

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution for securing firearm in my bedroom!!!
customer_reviews.text: Installed GunVault SpeedVault SVB500 in a HORIZONTAL mounting position underneath my bed! Fastest access method I've found for my firearm without leaving it on the nightstand!!! So far, I couldn't be happier with the SpeedVault. NOTE - unlike other reviewers have said, the biometric SpeedVault DOES include a method to disable the beep. Just hold the Learn button for 3 seconds until the green light flashes and you hear a couple of beeps!!! Hope the video review is helpful. -Keith
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Junk biometrics
customer_reviews.text: Battery is always dead when I needed fast access. My father-in-law was able to open it his first try with his finger print even though I only has added my fingerprint to the system. Garbage. I have resported to just using the key which is a security risk unless I keep it on my neck all the time. The keypad version seems like a better option since the biometrics are worthless. Even when I used it it would only open periodically which will get you killed if you needed to uopen it fast
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous2001

customer_reviews.title: Wish the biometric was a little better, overall happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: The biometric scanner is good not great. Just like practicing safe handling and drawing, you need to spend some time practicing opening the gunvault in order to be prepared in the event of required quick access. The safe mounts well from the back and both sides meaning you have options. The safe has plenty of room to hold one gun and fits for all three of the following: Glock 19, HK VP9, and FNS 9 (only fits one gun at a time).
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: I liked this unit at first, but after a couple of months, it forgot my fingerprints. Reprogrammed it and it worked fine, but the next day it had gone blank again. Reprogrammed it again, and the same thing the following day. At that point I gave up. To Amazon's credit, they gave a full refund, even though it was past the 30-day return period.
customer_reviews.author: SDO

customer_reviews.title: it looked good. It's functional and responds quickly enough
customer_reviews.text: Mounting the thing was a little tricky with my bid-ol-hands. But, once it was mounted, it looked good. It's functional and responds quickly enough. There's a slight delay, but I knew that going in. You may want to watch it on YouTube a few times. I don't think the delay is as bad as some people make it out to be. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to keep a firearm near you but out of the kids reach.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Especially for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: Installing it was the worst part. I put it in my nightstand, which didn't allow the door to open all the way which left very little room to maneuver inside to screw the security screws in. Other than that, it's a great product! It was very simple to set up the biometric fingerprint reader, responds well, and is very sturdy. The batteries are also very easy to install and replace. The inside light is a nice little bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Works as Advertised, Fits in full size truck center console.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Now that I have a toddler running around, I keep this in the console of my 2017 F250 to make sure he can't get to it. Fits perfectly inside the center console, even if it takes up about 1/3 - 1/2 of the space. It holds my conceal carry Glock G42 nice and snug. Works as advertised. Concerns: As others have mentioned, it does make a bit of a clunking sound when it opens, which you probably don't want in a home invasion. However, given the statistically low probability of that, versus the higher likelihood of my kiddo finding it, it's a sacrifice worth making in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: VAF84

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and install
customer_reviews.text: Best speed vault on the market! Went back and forth on deciding to buy this for a while and I finally gave in and purchased it. I have had this for over a year now and so far its worked flawlessly everytime. Easy to install, although i found that youtube tutorials from other people made understanding the install a litlle easier but the instructions are ok. Easy to setup finger print scans as well. It fit my full size springfield xd 9 with a mounted light with no clearance issues. I cut out a slot in the foam to fit a spare magazine beneath the grip and that worked perfectly fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: The Z’s

customer_reviews.title: I Fully Endorse!
customer_reviews.text: This product is GREAT. Some of the reviews say it's not the best. I disagree. This product is of sturdy construction. You also have to be smart enough to enroll each of your fingerprints MULTIPLE Times otherwise the device won't recognize it. Even iPhone makes you scan your thumb over and over again. Common sense. All mounting hardware is included and super easy to set up. Fully recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Francorage

customer_reviews.title: Fingerprint opening takes to many tries - TO LONG
customer_reviews.text: Gave this Biometric gun safe as a gift. Person says it will open with finger, but takes numerous tries. Often taking 10 seconds of trying. When seconds matter, that is too unreliable. Imagine in a true emergency, a person would be lucky to get it open at all.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Not Reliable
customer_reviews.text: The biometric (finger print) scanner is unreliable and not something you want to have to depend on in an emergency situation. I reset the scanner (i.e., stored my thumb print) at least a dozen times and could never get the scanner to work dependably. Specifically, sometimes it wouldn't open at all and other times it would open after 5-6 attempts. I'm not sure if the biometric scanner was defective on my gunvault or if this problem if typical of other units. In any event, my gunvault was simply UNRELIABLE and I returned it for a refund. I would NOT recommend this gunvault if you may need to access your pistol in an emergency situation.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H. Davis Jr

customer_reviews.title: FRAUD!!!!  It will open for anything even your forearm don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: I’m surprised it is even legal to sell something that opens with any piece of skin put on the fingerprint scanner I even used the back of my fingernail and it opened for that so if you’d like to buy a gun safe that your kids can easily access and shoot someone or themself this is the gun safe for you!! Terrible design and I will be contacting the manufacturer to figure out why that is even being sold
customer_reviews.author: Precision Wheels

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product but wouldn't consistently read my fingerprint
customer_reviews.text: Set the product up and saved both mine and my wife's finger prints. It would open every time for her but only occasionally for me. I reset the fingerprints and only entered mine and still would not read mine. My wife never had an issue. I ended up returning for the same safe with the 4 button code instead of the biometric reader. Very well built product.
customer_reviews.author: TCrox

customer_reviews.title: Sent back. Double your money for a more reliable safe.
customer_reviews.text: At first it was great. It was semi easy to install and get finger prints set up. I didn't like that you have to slide your finger prints over the scanner several times before the gun drops. After week 2 or 3 the finger print reader stopped working. I just sent it back for a refund from Amazon last week.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic single gun quick access safe
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an easy access single pistol safe option and this one from GunVault fit perfectly. Here is a quick run down based on my experience with it. Pros: - Easy to install - Fits nearly any pistol - Simple to program - No need for a key just your finger - Has a key override - Can learn multiple users finger prints - Well built. Cons: - Very minor issue but it takes about 2 full seconds from the time the reader confirmed your finger print to then drop open the access door. But realistically you would be fumbling with a key or combination for at least that long if not longer using any other solution.
customer_reviews.author: Flinx

customer_reviews.title: Biometric Doesn't Work - Can not recommend purchase of this product
customer_reviews.text: After some 15-20 reset attempt over 2-1/2 months, the bio-metric system still doesn't work properly losing its programming almost immediately after setting administrative finger prints. I am the only user of this safe and it will doesn't work. I went against the reviews because I had such a good experience with a competitors product (Barsa) and the size and configuration profile met my need. I will reach out to the manufacturer and see how they will handle this issue. I have given the safe far more chances and resets attempts than I should have. I'm left with a non functional bio-metric safe.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly. My wife and I feel very safe ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. My wife and I feel very safe with it. Will be getting another one. If your mounting it to drywall and your gun is heavy (all steel) make sure you anchor it properly. Repeated opening of the vault with a heavy gun assisted by gravity could work your anchors loose.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Rose

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Fast access when it counts.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to say bad here. This thing is quality, quality, quality. Very easy to use and program. Less than 2 seconds till a cocked, locked, and ready to rock pistol is in your hand. Easy to mount, flawless bio scan every time. I programmed mine for all 10 fingers in case of emergency. If your on the fence about the keyed one vs the fingerprint scanner get this one, way quieter and just as fast if not faster. The scanner is impossible to fool. You ain't getting in this thing without one of my fingers minus half an hour with a crowbar and in the shop with a grinder or torch lol.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Generally Reliable, Instructions Ambiguous
customer_reviews.text: Biometric sensor is generally reliable. However, you must wait a second or so after waking up the unit before attempting a swipe. Swiping too soon therefore induces a failure. My other complaint is that the included instructions are ambiguous and obviously were not written by or proofread by someone with appropriate insight. Either that or they're lazy and careless.
customer_reviews.author: drk1992fu

customer_reviews.title: I am thoroughly satisfied. I read some other reviews that indicated the ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these GunVaults one for office and one for home. They were simple to install, however after taking off the rubber stopper at the bottom I still found it challenging to get my hand in the safe to screw in the thumb screws. I also watched a video on YouTube on programming the Biometric lock and it was simple to program. I am thoroughly satisfied. I read some other reviews that indicated the safe could be unlocked with any finger including ones not programmed. I should mention that if the safe is not programmed correctly any finger will be able to open it. Watch the video on YouTube and it’s simole to do it correctly.
customer_reviews.author: LJNLAW

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable fingerprint recognition and awkward keypad.
customer_reviews.text: On the positive side, these units fit inside my nightstands perfectly and do secure the guns. Installation was easy. The biometric version recognizes my fingerprint on the first try about 30% of the time, requiring me to make multiple attempts to open it the other 70% of the time. The version that uses the passcode is more reliable, but still not as reliable as I think it should be, because the passcode must be entered with precise timing, and with a distinct release of each button before pressing the next button. It fails to recognize the code if you enter the it too fast, so you won't be using your touch-typing skills to open this.
customer_reviews.author: Peter T. Deal

customer_reviews.title: Great but could be better
customer_reviews.text: So I'll start by saying that the safe functions great and seems very sturdy and the biometric feature was simple to set up. I'm taking a star away for the instructions for instillation not being very clear And I'm also taking a star because the provided screws need to be screwed into some sturdy wood. I tried placing them on studs but it seems they were only long enough to go through the dry wall and as soon as I placed a gun inside it fell off the wall leaving 4 holes behind.
customer_reviews.author: labendeira

customer_reviews.title: Finger print reader is extremely weak.
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great, but you would die in an emergency. The finger print reader is both slow and faulty. It typically takes about two or three times to get it to work. If I hadn't already installed it under my desk I would have returned it. Save your money and look for better alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Digirati

customer_reviews.title: Works as described.
customer_reviews.text: While a little pricey, this item works just as described. Fingerprint storage can be done from swiping the finger from the front or the back, but does read it as a different print. So, depending on your orientation to the device you'll want to scan each finger from the front pulling it toward you, and then again standing behind it, pushing the same finger down. I love it, my wife loves it. It's a great solution for a home with children but want a relatively quick solution for home defense. This device DOES require a STRONG 9 volt battery. I had to get a fresh one before it'd accept prints into memory.
customer_reviews.author: Prepped

customer_reviews.title: Get fast access to your weapon when you need it!
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well. Opens quickly with the biometric reader. Drops open to an angle that allows an easy grasp of your weapon for personal safety. I had to call tech support to clarify the programming of the reader and got a response and a follow up email to make sure I was happy and the unit was working well.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Biometric system doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for bedside at night and to keep kids from access. Biometric system inconsistent, even with new batteries and programming. GunVault admitted that the biometric system is to be upgraded Summer 2019, but refused upgrade or trade in on current units. After paying $200, would not every buy from them again. They won't stand behind their product and support response was very poor.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good safe.
customer_reviews.text: The safe seems to work really well. The only issue that I have had with it is that if I try and swipe my finger over the reader even remotely quick that it does not read. You have to swipe your finger over it pretty slow. That may make it difficult to do in an emergency situation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keep your hand gun away from snooping toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a birthday gift for my son-in-law, this gun vault is terrific for keeping a curious toddler safe. He said it was very easy to program for his and my daughter's fingerprints and it opens immediately when it recognizes either of their fingers. He especially likes the ability to side mount on the nightstand. Now we all feel a lot better about the three year old wandering through the master bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: John Treble

customer_reviews.title: Excellent alternative
customer_reviews.text: Some reviews made me doubt a bit to go for this one, but I'm glad I bought it. It works excellent to my purposes, to have a low profile safe who will prevent my child or other unauthorized person to acces my gun. It is fast! Which was one of my pre-requisites. Easy to install, even in a concrete wall. I saved different of my fingerprints, in multiple positions, and therefore I rarely get a rejection. With a bit more of practice I will say the system will be 100% accurate when need it. I may buy another one to put it in a different location at home. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MarcoC

customer_reviews.title: Easy access
customer_reviews.text: Great product to secure a firearm. After watching a video of how to break into it, I applied a small bead of silicone caulk to prevent that. It is not as whisper quite as described.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Test it everyday. It worked great for awhile, but gradually over time it took a few swipes for it to open. After about two months, it didn't recognize me at all. My wife's thumbprint worked fine. I deleted all prints in memory, and scanned our prints to memory once again. It is working fine once again, but will check it daily. I will not be buying another biometric lock of any sort from now on. Save your money, and buy the combination numbered keypad. 03.23.15/Update: No longer recognizes my thumbprint since last update(03.13.15)
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick access to your firearm.
customer_reviews.text: This is the fingerprint version. I think its worth the extra money to have the finger print version, because you can more quickly gain access to your firearm. It was easy to install on my night stand. You do have to drill into your night stand. I have nice furniture, but it was worth it to have the added security so close. Its out of the way and concealed, when installed on night stand.
customer_reviews.author: michaelayoub

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: The vault is well made and easy to install. My only criticism is the reliability of the fingerprint reader. It seems hit or miss. Unless your print swipe is virtually the same as during the setup, it just doesn't read. Nevertheless I am happy with the purchase but find I generally use the key to open.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A.  Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY the safe stopped recognizing my fingerprint after one year of purchasing. It still works with the key but in an emergency situation I would have been in big trouble. I check frequently all my safety precautions and noticed by chance that the fingerprint scanner stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Jina

customer_reviews.title: Totally unreliable fingerprint recognition
customer_reviews.text: Atrocious fingerprint recognition. No more special than a typical lock and key safe since the fingerprint reading feature is completely unreliable, would never recommend for a life/death situation. 9/10 of my swipes are false negatives in low light conditions. Think I'll be returning product.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: Secure and Practical
customer_reviews.text: As long as I'm methodical when scanning my finger the vault drops open every time. If I rush or don't get the full fingertip swiped it rejects me. I'm only slightly concerned I won't be able to be so methodical in an emergency, but for the piece of mind it affords with small kids I can live with it. I will continue practicing unlocking regularly to get a good feel/to build muscle memory and hope it never actually matters.
customer_reviews.author: Rocloco

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. Takes about two seconds for the biometric lock to unlock once triggered but worth the wait to ensure the safety of my child. I considered the vault with the code lock but realized that with 4 number buttons a child could potentially open the vault if he/she really wanted to and had time or luck in figuring out the combination by trail. I just feel safer knowing no one can match my print.
customer_reviews.author: NEDO

customer_reviews.title: Noisy but good
customer_reviews.text: All is well with the exception of the "KLANK" when it opens. I first bought the biometric vs and that went right back. Could not program it and Opticspalnet said they get a lot of those back. I guess they're too sensitive to any change in your fingerprint like a cut or dirt or ... as I was told. Heck of a thing to count on in an emergency. My wife also likes this unit - finds it easy to operate and dependable. It's on a wall in a hallway and no one notices it's there except us. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Good safe to prevent unautorized access to a loaded gun, while still making it accessable to you.
customer_reviews.text: Great safe for any semi auto pistol you need to keep handy. My gun is secure, but easy to get to even without me looking at the safe. I have tested it in a totally dark room. You don't have to see anything to open. Mounted on an end table next to my bed
customer_reviews.author: Vz iPhone

customer_reviews.title: Not a good finger print reader
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not something I would depend on in an emergency. It won’t read my wife’s fingers. Takes 10 try’s to get in. I’ve tried different ways to learn the finger. Nothing works.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Shevock

customer_reviews.title: They are really great for super quick access to your firearm
customer_reviews.text: I've now bought two of theses safes. I keep one at bed-side and one under my desk. They are really great for super quick access to your firearm. I test them quite often and they have opened on the 1st try 100% of the time. Installation was easy, programing makes sense if you take a second to read the directions - and the firearm is really position perfectly for quick access and a draw that makes sense. The safe itself is very concealable - no one has noticed the one mounted under my desk - and dozens have people have been within 1-foot of it. A great solution for keeping a firearm at the ready while being secure!
customer_reviews.author: lems18902

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, secure, great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I needed a security solution that allowed quicker access to my firearm. The Speedvault is sturdy, durable, and secure. As a precaution, I’ve had everyone in my family try to access the locked compartment, but the fingerprint scanner correctly rejected their fingerprints.
customer_reviews.author: Koert J.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Safe
customer_reviews.text: I can't say anything negative about this product I have recommended this to about 4 of my family members and they have purchased as well with nothing but great things to say!! All my fingers and wives fingers are programmed, I have two little boys that I love to death and this safe makes all of us feel very confident and safe having a gun in there ready .
customer_reviews.author: WilliamsEmpire5

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little reluctant to purchase because of the BioMetric feature. I was pleasantly surprised with the ease of use and response of the reader. I open the Vault daily to make sure the batteries are working and I switch between 6 of my fingers and my two thumbs. I have also programmed my wifes prints so she can open it as well. If only I could get her to practice opening it every day. I plan to purchase another for her side of the bed and one for my office. I feel this vault will keep little and unauthorized hands from getting to its contents.
customer_reviews.author: G Forsythe

customer_reviews.title: Pops open automatically, can use any Finger, or Nose to Open!
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this in the beginning, quick, easy, instructions could have been a little better and bigger. However, safe began to automatically open and was just open. This week I come to find out that I can open it or any little kid with a finger that swipes at it. The design is great, but I feel let down by the bio-metric sensor. I would have given it at least a four otherwise
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bonifield

customer_reviews.title: Solid Build, Sufficient Size, Quiet Operation.
customer_reviews.text: Using some metal hardware, I mounted to a metal post. I really like the disable alarm function. The biometric usually works on first scan. If I'm going fast, may have to do it 2 or 3 times--but that's "operator error" not the vault IMO. The release mechanism is very quiet. It opens fast and has a good damper--nearly noise-free. The "beeper" is easy for the owner to disable. Holds a "large caliber compact" and one extra magazine with no problem. I have another brand biometric, and I prefer this one for the reasons above.
customer_reviews.author: Chessie Trotline

customer_reviews.title: Solid product and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: A great solution for a home based solution for securing a firearm from children / a possible intruder. In addition to the product working well I accidentally broke the battery cover and after inquiring to buy a replacement part they immediately shipped a replacement part to me for free.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Lowe

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Fingerprint scanner works almost every time. With practice it works 99% of the time. The directions are kind of janky, as other have stated. Once you figure out how to get your prints memorized, it's fairly easy. The version I got DOES have a mute version for the beeping, which is something I was concerned about. I have my unit mounted to my bed, and it mounted quickly and easily. It does still make some noise when it drops, so if you ever needed to use this in a situation that required silence, you would want to put your hand in front of it after scanning.
customer_reviews.author: StevieG013

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Inside light would not cut off when closing so I had to take apart and adjust the height of cut off switch but now working with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Ira V. Fortune

customer_reviews.title: Works and well built
customer_reviews.text: Just slower than I wanted buy works. Have to give it a sec to read your finger. But still faster then pushing a combo
customer_reviews.author: Robert P

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about this thing
customer_reviews.text: I like it. The idea of a biometric gun safe is nice. But if you can't get your gun out when seconds count it really isn't that great of a deal. I installed next to the bed on my wife's side since I'm working at night. The fingerprint reader is small and sometimes it works then sometimes it won't. Really it's a flip of a coin. The next one I buy will likely be from another manufacturer. It's good quality and nice knowing kids can't get into it but scares me thinking my wife wouldn't be able to access her gun. Plus the instructions are vague and not really accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: great buy, fitted next to my bed
customer_reviews.text: great buy ,fitted next to my bed ,open and night and close in the morning ,lot better than under the pillow
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Atherton

customer_reviews.title: Very cool idea. Very neat looking
customer_reviews.text: Very cool idea. Very neat looking. As long as you do not need your gun for defense, it's okay because you can use a key to open it. I almost never can get the fingerprints to register and even when they do it takes too long and you have to wait to see if it works before you realize it didn't and you have to start all over again.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard D.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but loud
customer_reviews.text: Holds my FN509 very well, light is nice, but holy S it is loud. If there was ever a situation where you didn't want everyone your neighboring country knowing that you were getting your gun, this is not the safe for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amber M.

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my husband - by the time I gave him the gift, the return window was over. It does not work - will not register his fingerprint. Also, the cover to the battery casing is broken, and though that does not appear to impair the function, this is a "new" item and should be in new condition.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great at what's it's intended for
customer_reviews.text: This safe is intended for quick and easy access to your firearm and for that it works quite well. If you're looking for something that is nigh impossible to get into, keep looking. It will, however, be secure from kids and other people in the house. Others have complained about problems with the print reader, but I had no such issues. You create the master print and then scan the other fingers you'll likely use at various angles so it will open almost no matter what you do.
customer_reviews.author: DCE

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing investment and compromise
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing investment and compromise. It gives my husband the comfort of knowing he can protect his family in his own home and gives me the comfort of my children not being able to open it. My son can press the button all day and it will not open <3 He will even get a screw driver to it and it still is a champ!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Glass

customer_reviews.title: It works. Needs to be in a location easily controlled at all times.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. As described. Not as much a gun “safe” as is usually expected. Maybe more of a gun concealer.
customer_reviews.author: jc noevil

customer_reviews.title: Love this safe.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. Have it next to my bed. Love this thing. Set up was a little tricky but once I figured it out I registered several of my fingers and my wives. Recommend a high quality battery as when It starts to die it won't unlock so keep the keys safe. With simple hand tools I'm sure I could break into it in 1-3 minutes. Great to keep a pistol and spare magazine handy but away from kids and quick grab burglars. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good safe, bad directions
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made and so far works well but directions suck. It says to drag finger over sensor twice to enter a print but if you do nothing happens except the green light blinks. It appears that the new standard is 4 samples. As for the people complaining it opens when you touch the start button, that is true until at least 1 fingerprint is entered. Otherwise you could never open the safe.
customer_reviews.author: Carey Probst

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping the gun safe from children
customer_reviews.text: Great for keeping the gun safe from children. Minus 2 stars because the sensor is slow and it is too loud in the dead of night. I disassembled mine and added some foam to quiet the noise it makes upon unlocking. This should have been thought out by the company.
customer_reviews.author: Mort

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy mounting & using
customer_reviews.text: NOT a handy man here, but this was relatively easy and quick to mount. Just follow the instructions. So far, works like a charm. Opens every time with the correct fingers, and won't open at all for non-registered fingers. Several different mounting location options (either side, or the top). Overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: I was never able to use this as the instructions are worthless. With many attempts, I was not able to put it together in a way it can be used. What a poor design.
customer_reviews.author: rcubed10

customer_reviews.title: Very rarely reads my fingerprint correctly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Biometric Pistol Safe so I could open my safe more quickly in an emergency. The problem is, the sensor rarely reads my fingerprint! So I end up attempting to open this safe over and over and over again before it finally reads my fingerprint. I am sorry I bought it and will now have to replace it with a combo safe so at least I can get my weapon if I need it!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Cumming

customer_reviews.title: Keep the key within reach.
customer_reviews.text: He biometric feature is useless. It takes 10-20 tries to get the vault open. Reprogrammed numerous times - same result.
customer_reviews.author: R. Frye

customer_reviews.title: Measure first?
customer_reviews.text: Seemed too big for knee hole area of desk, however it was touted as a good place for it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy R

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Can be opened with a gum wrapper. Battery is inside so can't be replaced if it goes flat.
customer_reviews.author: m

customer_reviews.title: I like it! It works well
customer_reviews.text: I like it! It works well. Usually takes two finger "swipes" to get it to open. I agree that it needs longer screws for mounting into wood. I changed the originals out for much longer screws to ensure secure mounting to my bed post. The factory ones wouldn't prevent a thief from prying the whole unit off whatever it's mounted to. The sticker noting the serial number was not located where the instructions said it should be. It took a several times to get it programed correctly but worked well thereafter. I would recommend this unit to folks that have children in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Steve L.

customer_reviews.title: Was nervous about this, now glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: I had a "instant access" fingerprint safe before this one, that went back to the store. This one, is not going back, less then 3 sec access time, one scan (not multiple tries), and the door drops down, no knuckle scrapping (yes, I am a little bitter about "instant access" safe I had). All in all I would easily recommend this to you.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Fuller

customer_reviews.title: If you’re in a hurry, not the safe for you.
customer_reviews.text: It does a decent job, but it’s slow and imperfect when scanning finger. The biometrics require a slow, thoughtful button push and finger scan. Look somewhere else if you are buying thinking you want to access your gun in a second or two.
customer_reviews.author: Derek K. Stiles

customer_reviews.title: Quality case.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality gun safe, Beretta sits in perfectly and the safe has never given up on me. Every single time I swipe my finger it works. Cons: For "$200" it should have included a Krona battery, which I luckily had laying around, since I only buy them for (carbon monoxide beepers). But overall, the quality is great, installation is a little confusing, but once you install it then you will realize its usefulness. Safe shooting.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I gave it a four because most ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I gave it a four because most of the time it does not read the fingerprint on the first try. Although, it could be partly my fault for not swiping my finger EXACTLY as when I programmed it. I wish the sensor was more like the iPhone sensor that can read your finger at different angles. This sensor only opens if you swipe it exactly like you did when you programmed it. Could be a problem if I'm trying to access in a hurry.
customer_reviews.author: TLMII

customer_reviews.title: So Far Works Flawless
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews that this thing was cheaply made and could be cracked open with a paperclif but I think they are garbage. Is this thing impossible to break into...of course not. As a matter of fact I could probably break into it if I tried real hard but I didn't buy it for that. I bought this so I could easily access my gun and keep my kids out of it and I think for that purpose it will work without a hitch. Biometric is easy to use and hasn't misread a print yet. I would def buy this item again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Safe works as advertised. We had no problem to mount to the wall next to my side of the bed. We attached two 2x4s across two studs and mounted the bracket to them. After imputing our fingers a 4-5 times each, we got flawless, 100% response from the locking mechanism. Fits my Sig P229 perfect, but would fit easy and a bigger pistol. The only negative is that there is no notification when battery gets low, so we will have to activate the safe every few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Iryna

customer_reviews.title: Biometric fingerprint scanner
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased several different gun-vaults and the SpeedVault with the Biometric fingerprint scanner is by far the best vault for the use and security I need. I have small grandchildren but still didn't want to compromise on access to my weapon if needed and the Biometric fingerprint scanner allows me to gain access to it with out looking and at the same time restricts outside access. Additionally I am able to get extra brackets from GunVault so I can carry the SpeedVault from home to the lake or office.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Shoffner

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality. Horrible programinng process. Unreliable biometric. Will NOT hold a full size gun, especially with a light
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeps gun where it needs to be.
customer_reviews.text: Every gun should be kept locked away unless on the gun range. Unfortunately, sometimes quick access can mean life or threat of death. The ease of access enables a person to keep the gun out of the wrong hands while allowing a homeowner to safeguard life and limb.
customer_reviews.author: Mover & Shaker

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble getting it to recognize my fingerprint on a regular basis. I will continue to experiment with it but am cautious to use this as it seems finnickey. Speed and repeatable unlocking is key in a product like this.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Miller

customer_reviews.title: Horrible fingerprint recognition!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible biometric print recognition. Very disappointed. Takes many tries to get it to open. A coded lock is far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Fly Fisher

customer_reviews.title: It works great. I bought 2 more
customer_reviews.text: I bought one to see how well it would work and try it out. It works great. I bought 2 more, one for the office and now I have two at home also. I have been wanting to get this for awhile, but the negative reviews made me leery of this. I am glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Alldredge

customer_reviews.title: Worthless junk
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a while but after 1 year I went to open it and the battery was dead I replaced battery and it still doesn’t work. The finger print reader never really worked either. It took 3-4 tries to open it and so I mostly used the key. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Stay away not reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucked horribly. I put my finger in three times and it still took three times to open every time. It wouldn’t work for my wife either and putting your finger print was a task all in it self. Not user friendly and not reliable. I would hate to have this thing if my life depended on it. Which it does that’s why we buy these things in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: jared

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The concept is good however after managing to program the unit I found that it did not reliably read a finger, so I programmed other fingers thinking if one failed the scan I could try a second finger. sometimes it works after multiple attempts, however for its intended use it is just unreliable. With respect to the unit I its construction seems adequate, not a safe but a secure location. I will be returning this unit and purchasing the unit without the scanner as if you ever need to use it I dont want to have something unreliable. The reason for the two stars is on construction and design...
customer_reviews.author: Simon Cash

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift. He loves it. Had some difficulty getting it programmed with the fingerprint but works fine when he finally did get it programmed. It is somewhat larger than I expected it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Blake

customer_reviews.title: Nice unit
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these for the nightstand and liked it so much we got another one for the kitchen, now both ends of the house are protected. Deducted one star because of the noise the locking mechanism makes when opening But if something goes bump in the night the dogs will be barking anyway. No problems with the fingerprint reader. Good unit.
customer_reviews.author: Selltrans

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: These guys mailed me a returned product (it was not new in the box) that had a finger print scanner that didn't work. You can key into it but it's pretty much unusable as it is. Garbage. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: 3rdeddie

customer_reviews.title: Could never get the biometric function to work reliably.
customer_reviews.text: I went through two of these units and never could get it to work reliably. This is something that has to work on the first time, especially if you are in a situation where you need access to your firearm. I returned it since I could register my fingerprints fine, but reading it would take a couple swipes to get it to open, and there were times I couldn't get it to open after numerous attempts. Try the non-biometric safe if you need it to reliably open every time!
customer_reviews.author: SideFlare

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but unreliable with thumbs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for its intended use; keeping kids away. High quality manufacturing, sturdy, and easy to mount securely. Biometric functions better than expected, but not with all fingers. Using my thumb is iffy and I don't feel confidant it will open in an emergency when adrenaline runs high, but other fingers seem to work 100%. Reprogrammed several times and thumb still a problem. Tested using right hand; thumb 10 times, unsuccessful 3 times. Tested pointer finger 10 times, 100%. Tested middle finger 10 times, 100%. Apparently, I have a defective thumb. Fit my S&W 65 revolver no problem. Also fit my gov 1911 easily. 4 stars due to thumb reliability.
customer_reviews.author: RedBaron057

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first gun safe purchase for my first hand gun. I mounted between my bed and night stand as many others have as well. I mounted without the bracket by simply running bolts from inside the safe through the side of the dresser. This saved me about 1/2" of space which i needed. Programming was extremely easy and once my wife and I had the timing down, it opens every time. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Dandy

customer_reviews.title: SIX stars if they had it....
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product.. Mounts anywhere, easy installation, even comes with a screwdriver to install it.. The fingerprint reader works flawlessly, and the LED light inside is a nice bonus as well. I recommended this safe to my friends, and I also bought a second one as well..
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Baze

customer_reviews.title: Bought a second one.
customer_reviews.text: Like this so much I got a second one. Holds the gun securely but the sponge gives enough to allow my gun to fit with the rail mounted flash light. It just hangs on the bracket, so I wedged a piece of sponge into the gap to hold it still. I wish it would screw to the bracket, but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Ostrowski

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool little gun safe
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool little gun safe. Great for mounting next to bed. Only complaint is that it sometimes take a couple swipes for it to recognize a finger print. You need to work to get your "swiping technique" just right. Hopefully it never means the difference between life and death, but slightly annoying. Probably still just as quick as the button/code version of the vault even if you do need to swipe twice.
customer_reviews.author: dutchtriguy

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Great! Installed it in an area designed for books on my bed backboard. Only concern I have is the slow response (1.5 sec) from the finger print reader and the sound of the release lever. I open it when I go to bed and close it when i wake up. This way I don't have to worry about the sound or delay.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. It's mounted to my bedside table. My 3 year old tried to get in it, and it beeps to alert me, but she was unsuccessful and quickly gave up. Now she doesn't pay any attention to it. It keeps my gun safe and secure, very quick to access, and gives me peace of mind. Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: -E

customer_reviews.title: Get the Digital Keypad Instead!
customer_reviews.text: The safe itself is well constructed and would do exactly what I wanted if it worked properly. The finger print reader is very inconsistent and only works about 10% of the time. I waited too long to install it and by the time I found it wasn't working well the return time had expired. Therefore, I am stuck with it. I would strongly recommend getting the one with the digital keypad instead.
customer_reviews.author: John Seitz

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it, I enjoy the ease and functionality of this vault. Do yourself a favor and get yours now.
customer_reviews.author: D. HARDY

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Don't buy the cheap batteries. With good batteries the biometric scanner works every time. Two things I didn't like: #1 my Glock 19 with tactical light did not fit with the foam insert - I had to cut this to get it to fit correctly. And #2 it takes about one second longer than I would like to open. Overall, I am happy and would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Brown

customer_reviews.title: Touch and Go!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and use. Product is well constructed. The biometric access works well every time. The LED light inside is a great feature as well.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

product_meta.title: GunVault Speedvault Biometric Biometric Pistol Safe SVB500
product_meta.description:
Style:BiometricThe SVB500 speed vault biometric is the ideal quick access gun safe that allows you to use your own fingerprints as your unlocking code. This fingerprint handgun safe’s revolutionary design and discreet feel makes it a great fit for both your home and business. Get that added bit of security you’re looking for with the SVB500 speed vault biometric.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Keep your handgun safe, secure and ready for action with the SpeedVault Biometric. Offering a revolutionary design, the SpeedVault Biometric is equally as fast as it is discreet. It is the ideal choice for a home or business looking for added security.
feature_bullets: Bio metric fingerprint scanner and activation button; Holds up to 120 individual fingerprints
18 gauge steel construction, with protective foam lined interior

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars791 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
